Ye XU

Akihabara · Tokyo, Japan · (070) 4158-5095 · xuye1129@gmail.com

I'm a computer engineer experienced in Applied Natural Language Processing. I obtained my M.A. in NLP laboratory of Tokyo Institute of Technology, Japan.
After working as an R.A. in academic and full-stack python engineer, I decided to pursue my interest in NLP and officially took a full-time Applied NLP R&D developer position in AI2SQUARED Inc., where I directly connect with clients such as Japan Post, Accenture, Softbank.
My projects are usually end-to-end. After receiving requests from the clients, I start a working pipeline: data analyzing=>model designing=>implementing the ready-to-use system.
I heavily value communications with clients, I believe it's the foundation of efficiency.

Experience

Applied NLP Engineer

end-to-end solutions@A.I. Squared, Inc.

My work starts from the moment client's requests are received. Projects are carried out in three phases.
The first phase begins with doing pre-research and analyzing data and the client requests, I present several feasible solutions. With the joint effort from the clients, we determine on one or two solutions. I train models and implement corresponding systems to yield an initial performance.
Second phase involves parameter tuning, fine-tuning and making other system adjustments after more discussing with clients to reach the most desired results/kpi.
Third phase involves ample teamwork with other engineers , salesmen and clients to reach the final state of the project.

October 2019 - Present

Web Application Developer

Intern @ BETA CAE JAPAN

To explore by my strong interest in web development, I started an intern doing full-stack development. Aside from maintaining the functionality of various product, I designed several useful tools for management like attendance check-in application.

June 2019 - September 2019

Research Assistant

@Tokyo Institute of Technology

Conducting experiments with various research topics alongside professors. Researches involving topics like tabular text to sentences , cross-lingual semantic shift etc.
